snippet: Four East Asian nations have all submitted war films for the foreign-language Oscar. That's not where the similarities end.
abstract: Four East Asian nations have all submitted war films for the foreign-language Oscar. That's not where the similarities end.
lead_paragraph: 1:18 p.m. | Updated One of the intriguing mysteries of the competition for the Academy Award for best foreign-language film is trying to figure out why certain groups of countries submit films that are so similar in subject matter. For example, this year, as in 2011, several European countries have chosen films about interactions between Europeans and immigrants from poor, ravaged nations seeking sanctuary in the West.

headline.main: Fighting on Many Fronts in Asian Foreign-Language Entries
